intro: Astragalus tragoides, commonly known as the desert milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of North America. It is a perennial herb that typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, characterized by its slender stems and small, compound leaves. The plant produces yellow or pale yellow flowers in late spring to early summer, which are arranged in racemes. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Astragalus tragoides plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing forage for wildlife in its native habitat.
